snippet: A research firm says the income of middle-class American families is lower now, when adjusted for inflation, than when the recovery began five years ago.
abstract: The Upshot, news analysis; new data from Sentier Research shows that income of middle-class American families is now lower, when adjusted for inflation, than when recovery began five years ago; study illuminates why opinion polling shows that most Americans remain pessimistic about economy despite increased GDP, soaring stock prices and other positive signs.
lead_paragraph: A research firm says the income of middle-class American families is lower now, when adjusted for inflation, than when the recovery began five years ago.

headline.main: Why the Middle Class Isn’t Buying Talk About Economic Good Times
headline.print_headline: Why the Middle Class Isn’t Buying the Talk About a Strong Recovery
headline.content_kicker: A Recovery in Need of  a Recovery
